intro: Trimezia sobolifera, commonly known as the Hawaiian trimezia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream sides. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Trimezia sobolifera is considered a rare and endangered species.
